Gabriel Rivera: Game Designer

My name is Gabriel Rivera, I am a recent graduate from the University of California: Santa Cruz with a BA in Game Design with a specialty in writing and narrative design.

Find Out More

Goals

My work focuses primarily on storytelling, either it being through an interactive text-based story or through a different game mediums. As a game designer and writer, my main goal is to create an escape for people. For them to experience enjoyment, love, and entertainment no matter how big or small the scope is.

Get Started!

Resume

Resume link
3d-Isometric RPG
Ensol

Ensol is a 3D isometric narrative RPG set in a solarpunk world where the real enemies are the ones that want the best for you. Encounter enemies, upgrade your weapons, and ask your robot cat what is going on?! I worked on all the writing and narrative design of the game.

Adventure Campaign
Casa de la Marina
An adventure campaign designed for the ttrpg game: Kids on Bikes. This adventure takes place in a larger supernatural mystery town based on Santa Cruz. I was the lead narrative designer and writer.
Text Based Interactive Story
Casa del Rey
A text-based story game heavily inspired by Casa de la Marina. Take on the roll of Amber as she figures out what happened that caused her to enter a supernatural hotel and help her escape. I was one of the writers of this project.
Boss Bullet Hell Game
Cyber Jump
Play as Anita Gunn as she fights against Rupaw in order to improve herself on her upcoming quest. Made for a 2 week game jam. I worked on the visual novel cutscenes, both coding and writing.
3d Environmental Storytelling Game
Memories: Back Home
Play as a college student as you go through your own belongings and figuring out how you go to this point in your life. Made for a 2 week game jam. I worked on the writing and narrative design.
Interactive Story
Are you alone?
A horror interactive story game using custom code that I have adapted from my professor. The game has multiple unique endings depening on what the user does and does not do.
Interactive Game
Escape the Lab

A Sci-Fi interactive story game made using twine. This game comes with two major branching paths and nine distinct endings. How will you survive this the chaotic world you find yourself in?

Design Exercise
Finalize Me: Queer Stories
A character design exercise using twine. In this game, you're able to ask queer characters about themselves before finalize their appearance yourself. Meant for queer people and character designers.
